channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-13191] mvn site fails on jenkins due to permgen
item.description:
patch QA is failing the mvn site goal due to permgen.

looks like we have ~3 places we try to set it. consolidate.
item.summary: mvn site fails on jenkins due to permgen

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: +1 Go for it.
dummy patch for checking QA

+1

::fingers crossed::

FAILURE: Integrated in HBase-TRUNK #6236 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-TRUNK/6236/)
HBASE-13191 allow jenkins params to alter MAVEN_OPTS, and default to setting more permgen. (busbey: rev ed93ddd94f6264ca246477bece4bf2c895706a22)

  • dev-support/jenkinsEnv.sh
(integration failure is unrelated)

This message is automatically generated.

The test run has this curious output:


Maven options

\tMAVEN_OPTS=""-Xmx6100M -XX:-UsePerfData -XX:MaxPermSize=256m""

which shows that we're getting the jenkins job provided variable (the one in jenkinsEnv uses ~3G of memory), but we're getting it with an extra set of quotes. I'm going to try tweaking that to remove them.
re-upload so I can run qa again.

This message is automatically generated.

I found it! We were hard coding MAVEN_OPTS once test-patch was running.

unfortunately, we source the file that hard codes MAVEN_OPTS prior to applying hte patch, so there's no way for hadoop QA to test this without me pushing it.

Can someone do a quick check of this addendum?

make the "set MAVEN_OPTS if not already set" consistent with the usage used in the change to jenkinsEnv.

(sorry for hte churn)

Cool! Just hit this again on 12586..

Looks good to me, just this - MAVEN_OPTS="$

{MAVEN_OPTS:="-Xmx3100M"}

" - looks a bit strange at first glance (no bracket after second MAVEN_OPTS?), but I'd try..
+1 thanks Sean Busbey

that says

"assign the env variable MAVEN_OPTS equal to itself, unless it does not already exist. If it does not already exist, instead use the string literal "-Xmx3100M""
